frontmatter.title: Dynamic grid-based object placement
frontmatter.excerpt: In RTS games, when you place an object, it shows you where you can place it and where you cannot. In some games, like Starcraft, they have a grid that shows the collisions. This writing will go over on implementing a similar object placement.

frontmatter.title: Awesome Data Structures, BK-Tree
frontmatter.excerpt: BK-Tree is a data structure used to perform spell checks based on the edit distance (Levenshtein Distance) between two strings. The application of BK-Trees is approximate string matching.

frontmatter.title: Binary Search Tree Implementation
frontmatter.excerpt: Binary Search Trees are very interesting data structures. It's a tree where each node of the tree has up to 2 nodes, left and right. What makes a binary tree a binary 'search' tree is how the left and right nodes are added.
